returnValue.Activity_Name__c: Acting Communications Chair - Delaware Valley Chapter
returnValue.Description__c:
Volunteer Acting Communications Chair Role 


The Delaware Valley Chapter has an immediate need for an Acting Communications Chair. This is a great volunteer opportunity for someone interested in getting more involved with the DV Executive Committee and making a contribution to the success of the chapter. The Acting Communications Chair is responsible for developing and managing the communications budget for 2026, recommending strategies to allow the chapter to effectively reach broader and more diverse audiences, and coordinating messaging across the various communication channels used by the chapter, including the chapter website, newsletter, social media, and email blasts. Good leadership, organization, interpersonal and communication skills are helpful. Please contact Peni MacMeekin at vicechair@amcdv.org or George Cagle dvchair@amcdv.org  for more information.

returnValue.Activity_Name__c: Lambertville Loop
returnValue.Description__c:
This is an eight-mile hike from the unpaved parking lot behind Lambertville Station GPS 40.363613, -74.945984. We will cross the Delaware River to Pennsylvania and head north on the Delaware Canal. We will cross the River again to Stockton for lunch at a local restaurant and return to our cars in Lambertville.


"Please note: In order to comply with Pennsylvania Youth Protection Laws, all children under the age of 18 must be accompanied by their parent or legal guardian. This policy applies for all events offered by the Delaware Valley Chapter as well as any other Chapter events within the state of Pennsylvania."


Contact information (732) 668-3774

returnValue.Activity_Name__c: Retro Hike from 2019: Thursday Hike at Valley Forge (3C4-7)
returnValue.Description__c:
Join us for our popular weekly hike in Valley Forge National Park. There will be rolling hills, some climbs, and rocky trails, so you will need sturdy shoes and water. The hike course is designed so that hikers of all abilities from aggressive to leisurely can get the challenge level they desire. We usually have several trained AMC leaders present (Some may not be on Meetup) so we can split into multiple smaller groups by pace as necessary for ability and group management. All groups hike about 2 hours covering different distances from 5 to 7 miles.


Location: During the summer we meet at the Artillerly Park parking lot located oon East Inner Line Drive. (GPS 40.093825,-75.448934) Directions from 202 North or South: Get onto 4222 West. Take exit onto Route 23 and make a left into the park. Continue to follow 23 past Washington’s Headquarters and make a left onto Gulph Road and then take the second right onto East Inner Line Drive. East Inner Line Drive is a 2-way road directly to the parking area despit what your GPS says. Follow same directions if you are coming East bound on 422 (from Collegeville area), except you will make a right onto Rt 23 to follow into park. We start circle-up and depart at 6:30 PM. We suggest you arrive at 6:15 if you want totalk with your friends which may be hike at a different pace. Dogs permitted – park rules require a leash at all times. You may need to walk at the back of your group. Optional after hike get together.


Although sign up is not necessary please consider signing up on MeetUp. This allows rapid communication, vetting and tells participants who is coming. A paper waive will be available to sign at the trailhead. Signing up on the AMC site is also a possibility.


"Please note: In order to comply with Pennsylvania Youth Protection Laws, all children under the age of 18 must be accompanied by their parent or legal guardian. This policy applies for all events offered by the Delaware Valley Chapter as well as any other Chapter events within the state of Pennsylvania."

returnValue.Activity_Name__c: SOUTH MOUNTAIN PRESERVE, SUNSET SERIES #5
returnValue.Description__c:
Explore a shortened version of one of Lehigh Valley’s finest hiking properties, South Mountain Preserve. This 4.3-mile evening trek showcases some of the preserve’s best features, including a large boulder outcrop, multiple small stream crossings, and a diminutive waterfall. Expect a steady 500 feet of elevation gain in the first two miles, followed by a delightfully meandering descent back to your car.


The hike is rated vigorous for its climbing and uneven terrain but is not technical overall. Bring enough fluids for two hours of activity in anticipated warm conditions. Poles may be helpful in navigating rocky sections of trail.


Meet by 5:45 for a 6:00 start. Our trailhead is on Alpine Street at Boroline Park, Emmaus. Park in small lot or on street, both adjacent to trail system entrance.


South Mountain Preserve is owned and managed by the Emmaus-based Wildlands Conservancy. Together with the city of Allentown, this property protects more than 800 acres of woodlands and streams and offers 10 miles of interconnected trails at the edge of some of the area’s most intensely developed land.


This hike is the fifth of ten scheduled Sunset Series activities hosted by the Lehigh Valley Group of the Delaware Valley Chapter. Hikes of up to two hours are scheduled for every other Thursday evening into early September. 


All warm weather activities come with the risk of high humidity, severe storms, biting bugs, ticks, etc. Please dress accordingly and be mindful of your safety in the heat.


Participants are invited to an optional post-hike meal at Superior Restaurant, a nearby local landmark in the diner tradition.


If status of hike in question due to weather, phone/text leader by 4:30 PM. Leader Welles Lobb. 610-709-4455   


Please note: In order to comply with Pennsylvania Youth Protection Laws, all children under 18 years of age must be accompanied by their parent or legal guardian. This policy applies for all events offered by the Delaware Valley Chapter as well as any other Chapter events within the state of Pennsylvania.

returnValue.Activity_Name__c: 20s/30s Pizza Picnic & Yard Games at FDR Park
returnValue.Description__c:
FDR Park is a 348-acre park located near the Delaware River including outdoor activities such as tennis, boating, skateboarding and more.


Join us for a laid-back afternoon at this South Philadelphia park! We’ll enjoy a pizza picnic and classic yard games like cornhole and frisbee. It’s a great chance to meet fellow outdoor enthusiasts, relax by the lakes, and soak up the park’s natural charm. Whether you're new to the group or a longtime member, come hang out and have some fun!


Enter the park from Pattison Ave & 20th St and follow your GPS to the parking lot at Picnic Area A. Use Google Maps for best results.


Please note: This event is weather-dependent. In case of inclement weather, we'll notify attendees of any changes or cancellations day of by 4pm.


Please note: In order to comply with the Pennsylvania Youth Protection Laws, all children under the age of 18 must be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian. This policy applies for all events offered by the Delaware Valley Chapter events within the state of Pennsylvania.

returnValue.Activity_Name__c: Valley Forge Fast-Paced Workout Hike
returnValue.Description__c:
New starting time for summer: 8:00 AM


Join me for some enjoyable exercise: a fast-paced hike on Mt. Misery and Mt. Joy in Valley Forge National Historical Park. I will aim for 5-7 miles at an average speed of 3.4+ mph when moving (a bit slower in up-hill and rough sections, but faster in easier sections), with elevation gain around 800 – 1,300 feet. The intent is to offer fast hikers an aerobic workout.


Meet in the Artillery Park parking lot, at the end near the restrooms. GPS coordinates:  40.0939, -75.4490 


Bring water, clothing appropriate for the weather (layers work well), sturdy footwear (hiking shoes or boots work well), and a smile. Dogs are not permitted on this hike.


If the hike is canceled, such as due to weather, I plan to announce this at least two hours in advance.


Sign-up on Meetup is encouraged for those who use Meetup (https://www.meetup.com/Appalachian-Mountain-Club-Delaware-Valley-Chapter) as this allows easy communication and lets attendees see who has signed up. Alternatively, it’s fine to register here on the AMC website to let the leader know you plan to attend and to sign the AMC liability release agreement in advance. Children under age 18 must be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian, who will need to sign the agreement for them.


AMC is an outdoor recreation and conservation organization that, among other things, helps maintain the hiking trails we use in Valley Forge and many other parks. Non-members are welcome on this hike, but membership is inexpensive and supports the great work AMC does (click here to learn more).


If you are running late or have questions, call or text me (Pat) at 610-220-7012.


Let’s get some exercise and enjoy it!

Start_Location__c.street: 5450 E Inner Line Drive (Artillery Park parking lot)

returnValue.Activity_Name__c: Valley Forge Park Chapel Trail Project
returnValue.Description__c:
GENERAL

AMC and its volunteers partner with the Valley Forge National Historical Park and its staff to maintain the approximate 30 miles of public trails within the Park. Activities vary from trail hikes that include 1) general trail maintenance matters, such as pruning impinging vegetation; clearing fallen limbs and small trees from trails; repairing trail treads; clearing existing water management structures, etc; as well as 2) more intensive feature construction projects, trail bed enhancement/improvements, etc.


Wear weather appropriate clothing and sturdy shoes.


Bring water and snacks as appropriate.


The Park will make available protective eye wear/ear protection/hard hats/gloves as necessary as well as tools required to complete the planned work.


As required by Pennsylvania law, chldren under 18 years of age may NOT participate in these events unless they are accompanied by their parent or their legally appointed guardian.


All participants will be required to sign liability release agreements provided by AMC and by the Park.


No pets, please.


All trail work sessions will be subject to cancellation when weather conditions require.


CURRENT

We are working on the series of check steps on the eastern side of the Chapel Trail "Ravine." We are replacing deteriorated check steps and renovating others, as well as installing soil and gravel on the trail tread.


The group will meet at the Varnum Parking Lot which is located off the north side of Route 23 across from the Von Steuben parking area/statue.


There are public restrooms at the meeting site.


CO-LEADER

This activity will be co-led by Jeff Neuhaus. Jeff recently completed AMC Leader Training and completed the first of his two required co-leads several weeks ago.

returnValue.Activity_Name__c: French Creek Sunday Morning 10 at 9 Hike
returnValue.Description__c:
Join us on the trails at French Creek State Park at 9 AM.


We are doing around 10 miles, so expect a 9 to 11 miles long hike at a moderate pace. We can reach the farthest trails in French Creek at this distance. This hike is rated "vigorous" only because of the length. It is not geared to be a workout hike. We will take time to stop for breaks at the top of hills and as needed to keep the group together.


Expect less than 2000 feet total elevation gain the whole hike.


The starting location is at the French Creek State Park Playground. This is 800 feet southwest of the Hopewell Lake boat ramp parking area going towards the park office. The GPS coordinates for the playground are: 40.1983077435609,-75.79114511944678. Modern bathrooms at the start. We meet there at 9:00 AM and leave soon after. We normally finish about 30 minutes before the stated end time.


Bring water plus a snack if desired. We will stop to de-layer once we start moving. I have only limited text and talking cell phone coverage in the park at the start.


I only cancel this hike due to adverse weather conditions which make it unsafe to drive or hike. Check Meetup comments. I'll update the AMC database status too.


Well behaved dogs can come on this hike if they can keep up with the group. Owners of dogs not on leashes will be asked to leave the hike. Please post a Meetup comment in advance if you are planning to bring your pet.


On-line registration in the AMC system is not required for this hike; While I find Meetup convenient, I welcome and reserve spaces for AMC members from the Outdoor Connector website (go to http://activities.outdoors.org/ ) (Meetup is: https://www.meetup.com/Appalachian-Mountain-Club-Delaware-Valley-Chapter/ ). Update your RSVPs if your plans change. All participants will need to agree to and sign a paper AMC legal waver sheet just prior to the hike if you did not register on-line in the AMC Outdoor Connector.


Please note:

In order to comply with Pennsylvania Youth Protection Laws, all children under 18 years of age must be accompanied by their parent or legal guardian. This policy applies for all events offered by the Delaware Valley Chapter as well as any other chapter events within the state of Pennsylvania.

returnValue.Activity_Name__c: Monday Evening Hike in Phoenixville
returnValue.Description__c:
Hike Plan

This is an "easy" rated (shorter), but fast moderate to brisk paced 6-mile walk in urban Phoenixville, PA. We walk established trails and wide gravel/paved paths, mostly along the Phoenixville Canal. We will head into downtown Phoenixville on some evenings.


Location

The meeting place for this hike is at GPS coordinates 40.129247, -75.483021. The street address is 987 Port Providence Road, Phoenixville, PA 19460. Some maps have "Port Province Trail Head - Schuylkill River Trail." There is a bathroom at the parking area we use. We leave shortly after 6:30 PM.


Notes

On-line registration in the AMC system is not required for this hike; While I find Meetup convenient, I welcome and reserve spaces for AMC members from the Outdoor Connector website (go to https://activities.outdoors.org/ .) (Meetup is: https://www.meetup.com/Appalachian-Mountain-Club-Delaware-Valley-Chapter/ ). Update your RSVPs if your plans change. All participants will need to agree to and sign a paper AMC legal waver sheet just prior to the hike unless you register on the AMC Outdoor Connector site.


Please update your RSVP when your plans change since I will try to limit the group size to around 18 using waitlists in Meetups. You may be pulled in to "Going" the day of the hike, so take your name off the waitlist too if you decide not to go. If you are unable to cancel in Meetup, just Meetup message me or leave a comment, Thanks!


Dogs on a leash are allowed. Please tell the group in advance using Meetup comments.


Please note:

In order to comply with Pennsylvania Youth Protection Laws, all children under 18 years of age must be accompanied by their parent or legal guardian. This policy applies for all events offered by the Delaware Valley Chapter as well as any other chapter events within the state of Pennsylvania.

returnValue.Activity_Name__c: Weeknight Walks in Yardley (from Buttonwood Park) Highlights
returnValue.Description__c:
Join us for the second season of Weeknight Walks in Yardley.  


We will be starting at a new location this year, but the route will continue to highlight the picturesque Yardley Borough as well as the historic Delaware Canal path.  Our 4 – 5-mile walk will be at a brisk pace, and it will show-off some of the places that make Yardley special, including a Victorian-era Library at Lake Afton and a small stretch of Main Street.


Most of the route will be on relatively flat streets or on the very walkable canal path. However, there will be one steep incline towards the end of the walk, just before a short downhill that returns us to our starting point at Buttonwood Park. 


For those who are hungry after the walk, there are plenty of places to grab a bite in Yardley.

 

Location

We will meet at the large open shelter in the middle of Buttonwood Park.

Public parking is available adjacent to Buttonwood Park; there is also street parking available around the corner on Penn Valley Drive.  Be careful to only park in locations marked as public parking.

 

Notes

Advance Registration is required on Meetup or the AMC Website. All participants will need to agree to and sign the AMC legal waiver sheet prior to joining the walk. 

 

Please note: In order to comply with Pennsylvania Youth Protection Laws, all children under the age of 18 must be accompanied by their parent(s) or legal guardian. This policy applies for all events offered by the Delaware Valley Chapter as well as any other Chapter events within the state of Pennsylvania.

returnValue.Activity_Name__c: Evening Hike at Newtown Rail Trail, 5  miles
returnValue.Description__c:
Join us for a 5 mile moderate paced hike. We start at Newtown Rail Trail, Upper Southampton Portion (Second Street Pike Trailhead), then hike into Tamanend park.

Meet at 5:45 Hike starts promptly at 6:00

We will hike on wide gravel/paved paths, wooded and meadow trails. This is a moderate hike. The trail does have sections that can be a bit wet, muddy, and uneven. Wooded trails can be rocky.

Bring sturdy footwear and water.

Meet at Newtown Rail Trail, Second Street Pike Trailhead. The GPS is 40.171890, -75.044202

Inclement weather may cancel hike. If doubtful, check the status of the hike on https://www.meetup.com/Appalachian-Mountain-Club-Delaware-Valley-Chapter// the day of the hike or contact the leader.

Online registration in the AMC system is not required for this hike. All participants will need to agree to and sign a paper AMC legal waver sheet just prior to the hike if you did not register online in the AMC Outdoor Connector.

Please note: In order to comply with Pennsylvania Youth Protection Laws, all children under the age of 18 must be accompanied by their parent or legal guardian. This policy applies for all events offered by the Delaware Valley Chapter as well as any other Chapter events within the state of Pennsylvania.

Start_Location__c.street: 615 Second Street Pike, Southampton, PA 18966, USA

returnValue.Activity_Name__c: Valley Forge Tuesday Morning Hike
returnValue.Description__c:
New starting time for summer: 8:30 AM


Join us for some enjoyable exercise: an approximately 5–7 mile hike on trails in Valley Forge National Historical Park. The difficulty level will be moderate, with speeds around 3 to 3.5 mph in the easier sections, and lower in hilly and uneven sections (rocks, tree roots, etc.); total elevation gain will be around 700 – 1,200 feet. Trails on Mt. Misery and/or Mt. Joy will be included as well as flatter areas. We will stop periodically, especially at the tops of hills if some go up faster than others, so that we all continue on the same hike.


Meet in the Artillery Park parking lot, at the end near the restrooms. GPS coordinates:  40.0939, -75.4490 


Bring water, clothing appropriate for the weather (layers work well), sturdy footwear (hiking shoes or boots work well), and a smile. Well-behaved dogs are welcome on a 6’ or shorter leash as required by the park.


If the hike is canceled, such as due to weather, we plan to announce this at least two hours in advance.


Sign-up on Meetup is encouraged for those who use Meetup (AMC-DV activities on Meetup) as this allows easy communication and lets attendees see who has signed up. Alternatively, it’s fine to register here on the AMC website to let the leader know you plan to attend and to sign the AMC liability release agreement in advance. Children under age 18 must be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian, who will need to sign the agreement for them.


AMC is an outdoor recreation and conservation organization that, among other things, helps maintain the hiking trails we use in Valley Forge and many other parks. Non-members are welcome on this hike, but membership is inexpensive and supports the great work AMC does (click here to learn more).


If you are running late or have questions, call or text Pat at 610-220-7012.

Start_Location__c.street: 5450 E Inner Line D (Artillery Park parking lot)

returnValue.Activity_Name__c: Baldpate 7 mile WineBerry Hike
returnValue.Description__c: We'll meet at the Fiddler's Creek Parking area (may be a port-a-jon?) and proceed up the blue trail through the overlook to the red trail where we hope to encounter wine berries. Wine Berries are invasive so it is important to eat as many as possible to stop the birds from spreading them around. No containers though, Follow the red trail (it should be dry) to the PV blue trail and up the switchback to the white trail and onto the Horse Trailer Parking lot for lunch. There should be a port-a-jon there. After lunch we'll back track up the red trail to the overlook (unless there is a revolt) and make our way back to the cars. Dress appropriately, hydrate and take electrolytes if hot. Oh, and bring pruners if you want to lead as there may be a lot of briars and roses. We should have 3 - 300' climbs to get the heart pumping. All participants must be 18 years or older

Start_Location__c.street: 29C Fiddlers Creek Rd, Titusville, NJ 08560, USA

returnValue.Activity_Name__c: Wednesday in the Wissahickon
returnValue.Description__c:
Join us for a walk in the woods and meadows of the beautiful Wissahickon gorge


Expect a moderate to brisk pace, depending on the heat. ~5 miles, mostly on unpaved paths with dirt, rocks and roots. Expect hills. Bring along water and snacks - we will take a short break about mid way through the hike. Steady rain cancels - check status the morning of the hike .

Meeting location - Northwestern Avenue parking area, at the trail. Porta-potties at or near the start. Do not leave valuables in your car.


Please note: In order to comply with Pennsylvania Youth Protection Laws, all children under

the age of 18 must be accompanied by their parent or legal guardian. This policy applies for all events offered by the Delaware Valley Chapter as well as any other Chapter events within the

state of Pennsylvania.

Start_Location__c.street: W Northwestern Ave & Forbidden Dr, Springfield Township, PA 19118, USA

returnValue.Activity_Name__c: Fit For Free's Decide-Your-Distance Walk (1, 2 or 3+ miles)
returnValue.Description__c:
Looking to start a new fitness routine? Prefer the outdoors to the gym? If so, we have the perfect evening walk for you.

 

We’ll meet twice per month at the tennis courts in Memorial Park, Lower Makefield Township (Yardley), PA.  You can choose to join us for a one-mile loop around this unique park or continue for a second mile through an attractive local neighborhood. If you are feeling extra ambitious, you can stick with us for a third lap around Memorial Park – this time in reverse.  

 

We will return to the tennis courts after each lap, so it’s your choice – you can walk a total of 1, 2 or 3+ miles – whatever is best for you! 

 

The walk will be primarily on flat, paved trails or on sidewalks. There may be a few times where we walk through very short stretches of grass.  The plan is to walk at an easy, social pace, with the possibility of increasing the pace over the course of the summer.

 

We look forward to seeing you and working together towards our health and fitness goals!


Location

We will meet at the Tennis Courts in Memorial Park, Lower Makefield Township (Yardley), PA.


Notes

Advance Registration is required on Meetup or the AMC Website. All participants will need to agree to and sign the AMC legal waiver sheet prior to joining the walk. 

 

Please note: In order to comply with Pennsylvania Youth Protection Laws, all children under the age of 18 must be accompanied by their parent(s) or legal guardian. This policy applies for all events offered by the Delaware Valley Chapter as well as any other Chapter events within the state of Pennsylvania.

returnValue.Activity_Name__c: Warminster/Northampton Parks Evening Hike
returnValue.Description__c:
Meet at 5:45 Hike starts promptly at 6:00

Join us for a 4-5 mile moderate paced hike at Northampton Municipal park. The trail is an easy hike. We will be on all paved trails.

We walk from Northampton park to Warminster Community Park (the old Johnsville Naval Air base, were X-15 pilots, as well as the original crews of projects Mercury, Gemini and Apollo trained to withstand the effects of G-forces on the human body.) for 3.5 miles then back to Northampton park for a 1.5 mile loop.

Bring sturdy footwear and water.

Location

Meet at Northampton Municipal parking lot on Hatboro road. The GPS is 40°12'13.4"N 75°02'43.4"W

Inclement weather may cancel hike. If doubtful, check the status of the hike on https://www.meetup.com/Appalachian-Mountain-Club-Delaware-Valley-Chapter// the day of the hike or contact the leader.

Online registration in the AMC system is not required for this hike. All participants will need to agree to and sign a paper AMC legal waver sheet just prior to the hike if you did not register online in the AMC Outdoor Connector.

returnValue.Activity_Name__c: WASHINGTON CROSSING STATE PARK, NJ, FIDDLERS CREEK, BALD PATE, 8 MILES Morning hike
returnValue.Description__c:
Meet at 7:45 am Hike starts promptly at 8:00 am

Join us for a 8-mile moderate paced hike at picturesque Washington Crossing State Park New Jersey, Fiddlers creek and Bald Pate mountain loop.

Even though we start out on the canal, this hike is harder than my regular hikes. We'll do about 600 ft total elevation. There are creek crossings. If you use polls bring them, their good for the creek crossings.

We will hike on the canal, wooded, meadow, some paved trails and neighborhood roads. Your shoes may get wet. The trail does have sections that can be a bit wet, muddy, and uneven, Wooded trails can be rocky. We will stop for a short snack break little more than halfway. Bring sturdy footwear and water.


Location Meet at the Washington Crossing Bridge Parking lot in NJ.


Inclement weather may cancel hike. If doubtful, check the status of the hike on https://www.meetup.com/Appalachian-Mountain-Club-Delaware-Valley-Chapter// the day of the hike or contact the leader.


Online registration in the AMC system is not required for this hike. All participants will need to agree to and sign a paper AMC legal waver sheet just prior to the hike if you did not register online in the AMC Outdoor Connector.

returnValue.Activity_Name__c: MORNING HIKE AT TYLER STATE PARK 5 MILE
returnValue.Description__c:
Join us for a 5 mile moderate paced hike at picturesque Tyler State Park

Meet at 8:15 hike starts 8:30 at Fisherman's Parking, lot off Almshouse/ Newtown Richboro road.


We will hike on wooded, meadow and some paved trails. We'll do about 300 ft total elevation. The trail does have sections that can be a bit wet, muddy, and uneven, Wooded trails can be rocky. Trails can be muddy. The trails will be on today are Mill, Red Oak, Nature, Dairy Hill and Dairy Mill trail.


Meet at the fisherman's parking lot on Almshouse/Newtown-Richboro road. The GPS is 40.224264, -74.965888


Inclement weather may cancel hike. If doubtful, check the status of the hike on https://www.meetup.com/Appalachian-Mountain-Club-Delaware-Valley-Chapter// the day of the hike or contact the leader.

Moderate paced hike starting on the paved path loop, and possibly going across the meadow . 5 - 6 miles. Hike Plan

This is an "easy" rated (shorter), but fast moderate to brisk paced 6-mile walk in urban Phoenixville, PA. We walk established trails and wide gravel/paved paths, mostly along the Phoenixville Canal. We will head into downtown Phoenixville on some evenings.


Location

The meeting place for this hike is at GPS coordinates 40.129247, -75.483021. The street address is 987 Port Providence Road, Phoenixville, PA 19460. Some maps have "Port Province Trail Head - Schuylkill River Trail." There is a bathroom at the parking area we use. We leave shortly after 6:30 PM.


Notes

On-line registration in the AMC system is not required for this hike; While I find Meetup convenient, I welcome and reserve spaces for AMC members from the Outdoor Connector website (go to https://activities.outdoors.org/ .) (Meetup is: https://www.meetup.com/Appalachian-Mountain-Club-Delaware-Valley-Chapter/ ). Update your RSVPs if your plans change. All participants will need to agree to and sign a paper AMC legal waver sheet just prior to the hike unless you register on the AMC Outdoor Connector site.


Please update your RSVP when your plans change since I will try to limit the group size to around 18 using waitlists in Meetups. You may be pulled in to "Going" the day of the hike, so take your name off the waitlist too if you decide not to go. If you are unable to cancel in Meetup, just Meetup message me or leave a comment, Thanks!


Dogs on a leash are allowed. Please tell the group in advance using Meetup comments.


Please note:

In order to comply with Pennsylvania Youth Protection Laws, all children under 18 years of age must be accompanied by their parent or legal guardian. This policy applies for all events offered by the Delaware Valley Chapter as well as any other chapter events within the state of Pennsylvania.

returnValue.Activity_Name__c: Great Sourland Traverse
returnValue.Description__c:
9-10 mile hike on trails through NJ Sourlands region. Meet 9:30 am at D&R Canal hiker’s parking lot in Lambertville. Car shuttle to Baldpate County Park (Ted Stiles Preserve) for start of hike. Hike up and over Baldpate’s big hill and down the powerline cut towards Howell Living History farm. Short country road walk. Then up Dry Run Creek Trail and down Rockhopper Trail into Lambertville. There’s a porta-john in the Baldpate parking lot and others on top of the hill at Baldpate.  Please bring ~1.5-2 liters of water and some lunch/snacks. Sunscreen/hat for open sunny portions.  The drivers who took us to Baldpate to start our hike will need to be driven back to their cars at the end of our hike.


Please note: In order to comply with Pennsylvania Youth Protection Laws, all children under the age of 18 must be accompanied by their parent(s) or legal guardian. This policy applies for all events offered by the Delaware Valley Chapter as well as any other Chapter events within the state of Pennsylvania.

returnValue.Activity_Name__c: Valley Forge Tuesday Morning Hike
returnValue.Description__c:
New starting time for summer: 8:30 AM


Join us for some enjoyable exercise: an approximately 5–7 mile hike on trails in Valley Forge National Historical Park. The difficulty level will be moderate, with speeds around 3 to 3.5 mph in the easier sections, and lower in hilly and uneven sections (rocks, tree roots, etc.); total elevation gain will be around 700 – 1,200 feet. Trails on Mt. Misery and/or Mt. Joy will be included as well as flatter areas. We will stop periodically, especially at the tops of hills if some go up faster than others, so that we all continue on the same hike.


Meet in the Artillery Park parking lot, at the end near the restrooms. GPS coordinates:  40.0939, -75.4490 


Bring water, clothing appropriate for the weather (layers work well), sturdy footwear (hiking shoes or boots work well), and a smile. Well-behaved dogs are welcome on a 6’ or shorter leash as required by the park.


If the hike is canceled, such as due to weather, we plan to announce this at least two hours in advance.


Sign-up on Meetup is encouraged for those who use Meetup (AMC-DV activities on Meetup) as this allows easy communication and lets attendees see who has signed up. Alternatively, it’s fine to register here on the AMC website to let the leader know you plan to attend and to sign the AMC liability release agreement in advance. Children under age 18 must be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian, who will need to sign the agreement for them.


AMC is an outdoor recreation and conservation organization that, among other things, helps maintain the hiking trails we use in Valley Forge and many other parks. Non-members are welcome on this hike, but membership is inexpensive and supports the great work AMC does (click here to learn more).


If you are running late or have questions, call or text Pat at 610-220-7012.

Start_Location__c.street: 5450 E Inner Line D (Artillery Park parking lot)

returnValue.Activity_Name__c: JACOBSBURG STATE ECC: THE GRAND TOUR
returnValue.Description__c:
Join us as we circle the varied 1,168-acre expanse of Jacobsburg. Our hike will reach all corners of the park property and include shaded woodlands, successional fields, trails along the Bushkill Creek and its tributaries, and enough moderate ups and downs for a good workout. Surface ranges from gravel footpaths, to mowed grass, to rocky trails, to one short road walk. Total distance is around 8 miles with elevation gain about 700 feet.


Jacobsburg is 4 miles north of Nazareth, Pennsylvania, and positioned as an easy to access park between the Blue Mountain and cities and suburbs of the Lehigh Valley. It boasts 19 miles of trails, abundant space for wildlife, clean water for aquatic life, and the remains of a colonial-era village.  


In our attempt to stay ahead of the July heat, we’ll start by 9 AM and keep breaks for hydration and snacks brief. The hike is rated as vigorous for its length and varied surfaces but is not technical. Poles may be helpful for some.


Following the hike, all are invited to an optional lunch and ice cream social at Mountainview Drive-In restaurant at the edge of the park.


Be advised that, in addition to the normal concerns with staying hydrated in midsummer heat and humidity, major outbreaks of ticks have been reported this season in the Lehigh Valley area. Dress with this concern in mind and be vigilant for ticks on skin and clothing during and after the hike.     


Should the status of the hike be in doubt due to any form of threatening weather, phone/text leader by 7:30 that morning. The leader also reserves the option to adjust the length of hike if conditions warrant. Leader Welles Lobb. 610-709-4455.


Please note: In order to comply with Pennsylvania Youth Protection Laws, all children under the age of 18 must be accompanied by their parent or legal guardian. This policy applies for all events offered by the Delaware Valley Chapter as well as any other Chapter events within the state of Pennsylvania.

returnValue.Activity_Name__c: Valley Forge Park Chapel Trail Project
returnValue.Description__c:
GENERAL

AMC and its volunteers partner with the Valley Forge National Historical Park and its staff to maintain the approximate 30 miles of public trails within the Park. Activities vary from trail hikes that include 1) general trail maintenance matters, such as pruning impinging vegetation; clearing fallen limbs and small trees from trails; repairing trail treads; clearing existing water management structures, etc; as well as 2) more intensive feature construction projects, trail bed enhancement/improvements, etc.


Wear weather appropriate clothing and sturdy shoes.


Bring water and snacks as appropriate.


The Park will make available protective eye wear/ear protection/hard hats/gloves as necessary as well as tools required to complete the planned work.


As required by Pennsylvania law, chldren under 18 years of age may NOT participate in these events unless they are accompanied by their parent or their legally appointed guardian.


All participants will be required to sign liability release agreements provided by AMC and by the Park.


No pets, please.


All trail work sessions will be subject to cancellation when weather conditions require.


CURRENT

We are working on the series of check steps on the eastern side of the Chapel Trail "Ravine." We are replacing deteriorated check steps and renovating others, as well as installing soil and gravel on the trail tread.


The group will meet at the Varnum Parking Lot which is located off the north side of Route 23 across from the Von Steuben parking area/statue.


There are public restrooms at the meeting site.

returnValue.Activity_Name__c: Sunset hike series
returnValue.Description__c:
Join me for a Sunset Series 4 mile out and back walk at Bushkill Township Trail near Wind Gap.(40.82687,-75.31397) This is an easy walk on a wooded trail that leads into the Jacobsburg State Park. There is parking off Rt 512. We may have an after hike opportunity for ice cream at Daisy’s.


This is a sunset series hike offered by Delaware Valley Chapter of AMC and designed for participants of all abilities to explore a variety of nearby parks and trails. Sunset Series hikes typically are 3-5 miles and take 2 hours, ending before dusk.

Bring snacks and sufficient water. Prepare for sun and insects.

Heavy rain cancels so please check outdoor connector the day of the hike.


Please note: In order to comply with Pennsylvania Youth Protection laws, all children under 18 years of age must be accompanied by their parent or legal guardian. This policy applies to all events offered by the Delaware Valley Chapter as well as any other chapter events within the state of Pennsylvania.

Start_Location__c.street: E Moorestown Rd & Bushkill Twp Trail, Bushkill Township, PA 18091, USA

returnValue.Activity_Name__c: Moring Hike Watershed Reserve, 5-7 miles
returnValue.Description__c:
Meet at Watershed Institute, 31 Titus Mill Rd, Pennington, NJ 08534 parking lot at 6:15 am Hike starts promptly at 6:30 am

Join me for a 5-7 mile moderate paced hike at Watershed reserve. This is an exploratory hike (I haven’t done this hike yet; I have mapped it out though) The first loop is about 4.5 miles. Second loop 2-3 miles. After first loop people can cut out of hike, we will be back at meeting point before I do second loop.

The trails I think are relatively level maybe 200 feet elevation, I don’t see any big inclines.

Bring sturdy footwear, water.

Location

Meet at Mercer Meadows-Reed/Bryan Farm parking lot on Federal City Road.

Inclement weather may cancel hike. If doubtful, check the status of the hike on https://www.meetup.com/Appalachian-Mountain-Club-Delaware-Valley-Chapter// the day of the hike or contact the leader.


Online registration in the AMC system is not required for this hike. All participants will need to agree to and sign a paper AMC legal waver sheet just prior to the hike if you did not register online in the AMC Outdoor Connector.


﻿Please note: In order to comply with Pennsylvania Youth Protection Laws, all children under the age of 18 must be accompanied by their parent or legal guardian. This policy applies for all events offered by the Delaware Valley Chapter as well as any other Chapter events within the state of Pennsylvania.

returnValue.Activity_Name__c: Backpacking Phoenicia East Branch Trail - Catskills
returnValue.Description__c:
This is a 22-mile point-to-point backpacking trip on the Phoenicia East Branch Trail in the southern Catskills. This hike is relatively difficult but has great views. Water availability can be an issue when camping up on the ridgeline, so Hike Leader (HL) has reserved a campsite at Woodland Valley Campgrounds (NY-DEC) for both Friday and Saturday night. Participants will share the cost of this campsite ($57 total to be split equally). Staying at this site will allow us to slackpack both days.


Friday – meet at the Campground Friday evening so we can get an early start on Saturday. Set up camp – and we can leave it set up until Sunday morning.


Saturday – will shuttle and then hike from Denning TH back to the Campground -- following the Phoenicia East Branch. It is about 10 miles with +1900 and -2600 elevation. 


Sunday - hike from Campground to Romer TH. It is about 11 miles with +2800 and -3300 elevation.


Since this is a point-to-point hike, we will be shuttling vehicles. Saturday morning shuttle from Campground to Romer parking area (end of hike) is approximately 10 minutes. Then from Romer to the Denning Road parking area is approximately 1 hour. Sunday afternoon shuttle from Romer to the Campground 10 minutes, and from Campground to Denning Road about 1 hour.

returnValue.Activity_Name__c: Rickett's Glenn, Eckley Mining Village 2 night Campout.
returnValue.Description__c:
Join Larry and Friends for a 2 night campout at Iconic Ricketts Glen State Park. On Friday we'll meet at 9:30, hike the falls trail, passing 22 waterfalls, set up tents near Lake Jean, maybe sample the food and beverages at the Ricketts Glenn Hotel and wrap up the evening with a campfire before retiring to our tents. Saturday we'll drive about an hour to visit the Eckley Mining Village. This original mining town was recreated for the movie The Molly McGuires, starring Sean Connery. It was then taken over by the state and additionally restored as an authentic mining community.

Returning to our campsite we should have time for a shorter hike around Lake Jean and Cherry Creek, consider some dinner options and have a campfire before retiring.

Sunday morning will most likely be pack up and go time , but we'll keep another short hike open as an additional option. Call or text with questions,

Larry Priori, 484 459 5445. Larrypriori@gmail.com.

returnValue.Activity_Name__c: French Creek Sunday Morning 10 at 9 Hike
returnValue.Description__c:
Join us on the trails at French Creek State Park at 9 AM.


We are doing around 10 miles, so expect a 9 to 11 miles long hike at a moderate pace. We can reach the farthest trails in French Creek at this distance. This hike is rated "vigorous" only because of the length. It is not geared to be a workout hike. We will take time to stop for breaks at the top of hills and as needed to keep the group together.


Expect less than 2000 feet total elevation gain the whole hike.


The starting location is at the French Creek State Park Playground. This is 800 feet southwest of the Hopewell Lake boat ramp parking area going towards the park office. The GPS coordinates for the playground are: 40.1983077435609,-75.79114511944678. Modern bathrooms at the start. We meet there at 9:00 AM and leave soon after. We normally finish about 30 minutes before the stated end time.


Bring water plus a snack if desired. We will stop to de-layer once we start moving. I have only limited text and talking cell phone coverage in the park at the start.


I only cancel this hike due to adverse weather conditions which make it unsafe to drive or hike. Check Meetup comments. I'll update the AMC database status too.


Well behaved dogs can come on this hike if they can keep up with the group. Owners of dogs not on leashes will be asked to leave the hike. Please post a Meetup comment in advance if you are planning to bring your pet.


On-line registration in the AMC system is not required for this hike; While I find Meetup convenient, I welcome and reserve spaces for AMC members from the Outdoor Connector website (go to http://activities.outdoors.org/ ) (Meetup is: https://www.meetup.com/Appalachian-Mountain-Club-Delaware-Valley-Chapter/ ). Update your RSVPs if your plans change. All participants will need to agree to and sign a paper AMC legal waver sheet just prior to the hike if you did not register on-line in the AMC Outdoor Connector.


Please note:

In order to comply with Pennsylvania Youth Protection Laws, all children under 18 years of age must be accompanied by their parent or legal guardian. This policy applies for all events offered by the Delaware Valley Chapter as well as any other chapter events within the state of Pennsylvania.

returnValue.Activity_Name__c: Fit For Free's Decide-Your-Distance Walk (1, 2 or 3+ miles)
returnValue.Description__c:
Looking to start a new fitness routine? Prefer the outdoors to the gym? If so, we have the perfect evening walk for you.

 

We’ll meet twice per month at the tennis courts in Memorial Park, Lower Makefield Township (Yardley), PA.  You can choose to join us for a one-mile loop around this unique park or continue for a second mile through an attractive local neighborhood. If you are feeling extra ambitious, you can stick with us for a third lap around Memorial Park – this time in reverse.  

 

We will return to the tennis courts after each lap, so it’s your choice – you can walk a total of 1, 2 or 3+ miles – whatever is best for you! 

 

The walk will be primarily on flat, paved trails or on sidewalks. There may be a few times where we walk through very short stretches of grass.  The plan is to walk at an easy, social pace, with the possibility of increasing the pace over the course of the summer.

 

We look forward to seeing you and working together towards our health and fitness goals!


Location

We will meet at the Tennis Courts in Memorial Park, Lower Makefield Township (Yardley), PA.


Notes

Advance Registration is required on Meetup or the AMC Website. All participants will need to agree to and sign the AMC legal waiver sheet prior to joining the walk. 

 

Please note: In order to comply with Pennsylvania Youth Protection Laws, all children under the age of 18 must be accompanied by their parent(s) or legal guardian. This policy applies for all events offered by the Delaware Valley Chapter as well as any other Chapter events within the state of Pennsylvania.

returnValue.Activity_Name__c: LAMBERTVILLE LOOP W/LUNCH - NEW START TIME - 7-8 Miles
returnValue.Description__c:
Meet before 945 AM near the Lambertville Station Restaurant and Inn in the free unpaved parking lot behind the Inn on the right. We will walk over to New Hope and up the PA Canal footpath to Center Bridge then cross the river to Stockton, NJ. where we will take a short break for a snack/lunch then return to Lambertville on the NJ rail trail. Note that the deli where we used to eat in Stockton is closed so you may want to bring your lunch or pick up a snack/meal at one of the other establishments. Pace will be easy to moderate and may include multiple stops. Bring plenty of water. Remember this is summer. Electrolytes are a good support mechanism in heat. Heavy or steady rain with lightning and thunder may cancel. If in doubt, contact L morning of hike or log on to www.amcdv.org and check the activity calendar. This is a flat walking path with no elevation gain.


Please note: In order to comply with Pennsylvania Youth Protection Laws, all children under the age of 18 must be accompanied by their parent or legal guardian. This policy applies for all events offered by the Delaware Valley Chapter as well as any other Chapter events within the state of Pennsylvania.

returnValue.Activity_Name__c: How to Long Distance Hike: Planning and Completing 20+ Mile Day Hikes
returnValue.Description__c:
Ready to take your hiking to the next level?


Whether you're new to long-distance hiking or just curious about covering more miles in a single day, this beginner-friendly online lecture will help you build the confidence and skills to hike 20+ miles safely, successfully, and hopefully enjoyably. Jeff and Barbara Fritzinger are longtime AMC leaders and trainers and have completed many long hikes together.


We'll walk you through the essentials of planning, training, and trail strategy so you can push your limits while being fully prepared, managing the risks, and setting yourself up for not only success, but a lasting sense of pride and accomplishment. Topics include:


  • Choosing the right route with check-in points and any group dynamics
  • Understanding terrain, elevation, and safety factors
  • Food, hydration, and gear essentials
  • Training tips that encompass the many different needs to be successful
  • Realistic hike-day strategies that help you stay strong to the finish

This session is interactive and designed for all experience levels—no prior long-distance hiking required. Join us via Webex and take your first step toward your own SuperHike adventure!


Special Registration Info: This workshop is a Field Trip, a type of AMC experience designed to explore a particular aspect of the great outdoors. Field Trips are open to both AMC members and non-members, but members get priority and come for free.

  • AMC Members: Please register for FREE using this linked form (membership will be verified)
  • Non-Members: Register and pay $5 here on AMC's website
  • Non-Member Special Membership Offer! Become an AMC member for $40 during registration and you can attend the activity for free! You can then attend any Field Trip event during the rest of your membership year FOR FREE.

Please note: In order to comply with Pennsylvania Youth Protection Laws, all children under 18 years of age must be accompanied by their parent or legal guardian. This policy applies for all events offered by the Delaware Valley Chapter as well as any other Chapter events within the state of Pennsylvania.
returnValue.Keywords__c: field trip, super hike, hiking, hike

returnValue.Activity_Name__c: 20-30’S MORNING HIKE, TALL PINES STATE PRESERVE AND WOODS OF WENONAH 5-6 MILES
returnValue.Description__c:
Join us for a 5-6-mile moderate paced hike at picturesque: Tall Pines State Preserve and Woods of Wenonah.

Meet at 8:45 am. Hike starts promptly at 9:00 am Tall Pines State Preserve, 1705 Glassboro Rd, Sewell, NJ 08080


We will hike on wooded, meadow, some paved trails and some neighbor roads. We'll do about 300 ft total elevation. The trail does have sections that can be a bit wet, muddy, and uneven, Wooded trails can be rocky. During the hike please don't be afraid to speak up if you need a break. This isn't a long hike, and we have plenty of time for breaks, but I'm known to just keep walking.

Bring sturdy footwear and water.


After hike (optional) Lunch at Louie G’s, five minutes away. Really good hoagies.


Inclement weather may cancel hike. If doubtful, check the status of the hike on https://www.meetup.com/Appalachian-Mountain-Club-Delaware-Valley-Chapter// the day of the hike or contact the leader.


Online registration in the AMC system is not required for this hike. All participants will need to agree to and sign a paper AMC legal waver sheet just prior to the hike if you did not register online in the AMC Outdoor Connector.

returnValue.Activity_Name__c: Lakes and Dips
returnValue.Description__c:
Join us as we take a nice hike in the Delaware Water Gap area and visit four different lakes and take a swim in each one. The entire hike is about 8 miles, but it is broken into approximately 2 mile segments between each lake & swim. About 700 feet elevation gain and loss. Wear your bathing suit or hiking shorts that can get wet, yet dry quickly. 


Meet at 9:30 at the parking lot for Blue Mountain Lakes (see driving directions below). There is a privy/changing room at the trailhead. Bring plenty of water and lunch as well as a towel and sunscreen, and a personal flotation device (like a pool float/tube) if you’d like. Water shoes are helpful as well in some situations.  


Any rain or thunderstorms will cancel hike.


Contact leader with any questions (trailsamc.tc@gmail.com).


Please note: In order to comply with Pennsylvania Youth Protection Laws, all children under 18 years of age must be accompanied by their parent or legal guardian. This policy applies for all events offered by the Delaware Valley Chapter as well as any other Chapter events within the state of Pennsylvania.



From Blairstown, NJ, take Millbrook Road (CR 602) to the historical Millbrook Village. Make a RIGHT on Old Mine Rd. Go about 1.3 miles and you will see a sign for Crater Lake on your right and large, old house just ahead. Turn RIGHT here on Blue Mountain Lakes Rd. (aka Flatbrookville-Stillwater Rd.). Go about 1.3 miles and park in the lot for Blue Mountain Lakes on your left.

returnValue.Activity_Name__c: Valley Forge Park Chapel Trail Project
returnValue.Description__c:
GENERAL

AMC and its volunteers partner with the Valley Forge National Historical Park and its staff to maintain the approximate 30 miles of public trails within the Park. Activities vary from trail hikes that include 1) general trail maintenance matters, such as pruning impinging vegetation; clearing fallen limbs and small trees from trails; repairing trail treads; clearing existing water management structures, etc; as well as 2) more intensive feature construction projects, trail bed enhancement/improvements, etc.


Wear weather appropriate clothing and sturdy shoes.


Bring water and snacks as appropriate.


The Park will make available protective eye wear/ear protection/hard hats/gloves as necessary as well as tools required to complete the planned work.


As required by Pennsylvania law, chldren under 18 years of age may NOT participate in these events unless they are accompanied by their parent or their legally appointed guardian.


All participants will be required to sign liability release agreements provided by AMC and by the Park.


No pets, please.


All trail work sessions will be subject to cancellation when weather conditions require.


CURRENT

We are working on the series of check steps on the eastern side of the Chapel Trail "Ravine." We are replacing deteriorated check steps and renovating others, as well as installing soil and gravel on the trail tread.


The group will meet at the Varnum Parking Lot which is located off the north side of Route 23 across from the Von Steuben parking area/statue.


There are public restrooms at the meeting site.

returnValue.Activity_Name__c: French Creek Sunday Morning 10 at 9 Hike
returnValue.Description__c:
Join us on the trails at French Creek State Park at 9 AM.


We are doing around 10 miles, so expect a 9 to 11 miles long hike at a moderate pace. We can reach the farthest trails in French Creek at this distance. This hike is rated "vigorous" only because of the length. It is not geared to be a workout hike. We will take time to stop for breaks at the top of hills and as needed to keep the group together.


Expect less than 2000 feet total elevation gain the whole hike.


The starting location is at the French Creek State Park Playground. This is 800 feet southwest of the Hopewell Lake boat ramp parking area going towards the park office. The GPS coordinates for the playground are: 40.1983077435609,-75.79114511944678. Modern bathrooms at the start. We meet there at 9:00 AM and leave soon after. We normally finish about 30 minutes before the stated end time.


Bring water plus a snack if desired. We will stop to de-layer once we start moving. I have only limited text and talking cell phone coverage in the park at the start.


I only cancel this hike due to adverse weather conditions which make it unsafe to drive or hike. Check Meetup comments. I'll update the AMC database status too.


Well behaved dogs can come on this hike if they can keep up with the group. Owners of dogs not on leashes will be asked to leave the hike. Please post a Meetup comment in advance if you are planning to bring your pet.


On-line registration in the AMC system is not required for this hike; While I find Meetup convenient, I welcome and reserve spaces for AMC members from the Outdoor Connector website (go to http://activities.outdoors.org/ ) (Meetup is: https://www.meetup.com/Appalachian-Mountain-Club-Delaware-Valley-Chapter/ ). Update your RSVPs if your plans change. All participants will need to agree to and sign a paper AMC legal waver sheet just prior to the hike if you did not register on-line in the AMC Outdoor Connector.


Please note:

In order to comply with Pennsylvania Youth Protection Laws, all children under 18 years of age must be accompanied by their parent or legal guardian. This policy applies for all events offered by the Delaware Valley Chapter as well as any other chapter events within the state of Pennsylvania.

returnValue.Activity_Name__c: Monday Evening Hike in Phoenixville
returnValue.Description__c:
Hike Plan

This is an "easy" rated (shorter), but fast moderate to brisk paced 6-mile walk in urban Phoenixville, PA. We walk established trails and wide gravel/paved paths, mostly along the Phoenixville Canal. We will head into downtown Phoenixville on some evenings.


Location

The meeting place for this hike is at GPS coordinates 40.129247, -75.483021. The street address is 987 Port Providence Road, Phoenixville, PA 19460. Some maps have "Port Province Trail Head - Schuylkill River Trail." There is a bathroom at the parking area we use. We leave shortly after 6:30 PM.


Notes

On-line registration in the AMC system is not required for this hike; While I find Meetup convenient, I welcome and reserve spaces for AMC members from the Outdoor Connector website (go to https://activities.outdoors.org/ .) (Meetup is: https://www.meetup.com/Appalachian-Mountain-Club-Delaware-Valley-Chapter/ ). Update your RSVPs if your plans change. All participants will need to agree to and sign a paper AMC legal waver sheet just prior to the hike unless you register on the AMC Outdoor Connector site.


Please update your RSVP when your plans change since I will try to limit the group size to around 18 using waitlists in Meetups. You may be pulled in to "Going" the day of the hike, so take your name off the waitlist too if you decide not to go. If you are unable to cancel in Meetup, just Meetup message me or leave a comment, Thanks!


Dogs on a leash are allowed. Please tell the group in advance using Meetup comments.


Please note:

In order to comply with Pennsylvania Youth Protection Laws, all children under 18 years of age must be accompanied by their parent or legal guardian. This policy applies for all events offered by the Delaware Valley Chapter as well as any other chapter events within the state of Pennsylvania.

returnValue.Activity_Name__c: Philadelphia Pride Hike
returnValue.Description__c: Join us as we explore the historical past of the LGBQT change movement in Philadelphia. Included are historical markers, memorable change agents, rainbow street signs, murals, important buildings and a flat city walk. Dress for the weather, wear comfortable shoes, bring plenty of water and a snack. All are welcome!  We will meet in front of Lloyd Hall on Boathouse Row. There is free parking on Sedgley Drive which intersects Kelly Drive at Lloyd Hall. There are restrooms available at the start of the hike and at several locations along the route.  "Please note: In order to comply with Pennsylvania Youth Protection Laws, all children under the age of 18 must be accompanied by their parent or legal guardian. This policy applies for all events offered by the Delaware Valley Chapter as well as any other Chapter events within the state of Pennsylvania."

returnValue.Activity_Name__c: Valley Forge Sunday Evening Hike
returnValue.Description__c:
Moderate paced hike starting on the paved path loop, and possibly going next to the river or across the meadow. 5 - 6 miles. Meet at 5 PM at the Valley Forge Visitor Center Lower Parking Lot at the picnic tables near the Restrooms and Bike Rental. Bring water.  Heavy rain, heat advisory, or lightning/thunder cancels.


Please note: In order to comply with Pennsylvania Youth Protection Laws, all children under 18 years of age must be accompanied by their parent or legal guardian. This policy applies for all events offered by the Delaware Valley Chapter as well as any other Chapter events within the state of Pennsylvania. ﻿(SEPTA Bus Route 125 stops at the Valley Forge Visitor Center)
returnValue.Keywords__c: Valley Forge , Saturday, moderate , evening , Joseph Plumb Martin , loop, 5  - 6 miles , weekend , paved path

returnValue.Activity_Name__c: 20s/30s Philly Chocolate Walk
returnValue.Description__c:
Some people say chocolate is the world's most perfect food! Come join us on a 3 - 4 mile walk through several Philly neighborhoods to visit some of the city's best Chocolate shops! Our urban hike will start at the Independence Mall Visitor Center (restrooms available). From there we will travel to South Philly's Italian Market and visit one of the top coffee and chocolate shops. We will follow that with visits to three other shops including America's oldest contiguous confectionary. Bring along a cooler bag if you plan to take some treats home. Those that are interested can join us at Spruce Street Harbor along the Delaware River Waterfront for drinks and lunch/snacks before returning to the Visitor Center.


Dress for the weather and bring along plenty of water and snacks if needed. The walk will be 3 - 4miles at a moderate pace. Steady rain cancels - check status by 7am the day of the hike or contact leader.


Logistics - We will meet at 10am at the Visitor Center, 599 Market Street. There are many public parking lots in the vicinity. Those who would like to take public transportation can get off at Jefferson Station (N. 12th and Market Street) and then walk 6 blocks down Market Street to the Independence Mall Visitor Center.


Please note: In order to comply with Pennsylvania Youth Protection Laws, all children under the age of 18 must be accompanied by their parent or legal guardian. This policy applies for all events offered by the Delaware Valley Chapter as well as any other Chapter events within the state of Pennsylvania.

returnValue.Activity_Name__c: Bowman’s Wildflower Preserve to Washington Crossing & back Hike
returnValue.Description__c:
Join us for a 10-mile summer hike on the Delaware Canal towpath. We will begin at 10:00am in the Bowman’s Wildflower Preserve parking area just off Rt 32 / River Road. We will hike south on the old towpath to Washington Crossing Park (PA side), then stop for lunch at a local pizzeria. After our lunch stop, we will backtrack on the towpath to the trailhead. It will be mostly level walking on good pathways

 

Please do not forget to bring water, perhaps with electrolytes if especially warm (i.e... HOT). Sun protection and lightweight ventilating clothes may also be wise for this, and all future Augusts.

 

Heavy rain is unlikely to cancel hike, however impending arrival of orbiting Borg Collective, may cancel hike. If in doubt, contact leader before 9:00am.


﻿Please note: In order to comply with Pennsylvania Youth Protection Laws, all children under the age of 18 must be accompanied by their parent or legal guardian. This policy applies for all events offered by the Delaware Valley Chapter as well as any other Chapter events within the state of Pennsylvania."

returnValue.Activity_Name__c: Know your Natives: A Guided Walk at Mt. Cuba Center
returnValue.Description__c:
What is a native plant? How does an ecosystem work? How do I identify plants? What can I do in my own backyard to help the environment? 


If you find yourself asking these questions, or if you love the outdoors, plants, and the environment, then join us Saturday, August 23rd for a guided walk around the Mt Cuba Center in Hockessin, DE. Leading the walk will be Peni MacMeekin, who is our Vice Chair of the Delaware Valley AMC chapter, as well as Peter Brown, one of the 20s/30s chairs. The walk will cover approximately 2-3 miles at a leisurely pace; stopping often to look at plants, trees, and shrubs, and discuss their size, shape, typical habitat, role in the environment, and more. It is recommended that only adults attend this particular visit; ages 16+ who are interested in the topic may also attend, but require a parent or legal guardian to attend with a paid ticket as well.


Mt. Cuba is a renowned botanic garden committed to the conservation of native plants and their habitats. It conserves and stewards more than 1,000 acres including meadows, forests, streams and riparian corridors. 


Accessibility note: Due to Mt. Cuba's rolling terrain and mulched paths, access to level, even terrain is limited. Please visit Mt Cuba's Accessibility page to learn more.


We will meet in the parking lot at 10am and begin our tour promptly at 10:15. Please feel free to bring water, snacks, camera, binoculars, sunscreen, or other outdoor essentials with you. 


Cost: Due to the nature of the tour, space is limited. We recommend that you register here as soon as possible. Non-member cost is $29 (which includes your Mt. Cuba Center admission ticket, a $20 value!), but members get to attend for free and the AMCDV chapter will pay for their ticket. All tickets will be purchased by AMCDV- so please do not buy a regular Mt. Cuba admission ticket for this event!


﻿Want to join us and attend this trip for free? See information below. Remember- if you a current member, register via the Google form. If not, choose your payment option below.


Refund Policy for this Trip: The tickets will be purchased on August 8th, 2025, so the last day that participants may receive a full refund will be August 7th, 2025. Unfortunately, refunds will not be possible after this date. If your plans change and you need to cancel your registration and/or receive a refund, please email membership@amcdv.org .


 This guided tour is a Field Trip, a type of AMC experience designed to explore a particular aspect of the great outdoors. Field Trips are open to both AMC members and non-members, but members get priority and come for free.

  • AMC Members: Please register for FREE using this linked form (membership will be verified)
  • Non-Members: Register and pay $29 here on AMC's website
  • Non-Member Special Membership Offer! Become an AMC member for $40 during registration and you can attend the activity for free! You can then attend any Field Trip event during the rest of your membership year FOR FREE.


Bios:


Peni MacMeekin is an experienced hiker and gardener who looks forward to welcoming participants to our chapter. She recently helped plant a pollinator garden at an Appalachian Mountain Club site in the Delaware Valley area.

﻿

Peter Brown is an active native plant gardener, and participates in many local environmental stewardship, restoration, and preservation groups including the Roxborough Manayunk Conservancy, PHS Tree Tenders, Philadelphia Parks & Recreation Tree Philly, and Valley Forge National Historical Park. 



Please note: In order to comply with Pennsylvania Youth Protection Laws, all children under 18 years of age must be accompanied by their parent or legal guardian. This policy applies for all events offered by the Delaware Valley Chapter as well as any other Chapter events within the state of Pennsylvania.

returnValue.Activity_Name__c: Vermont Adventure Hike and Bike experience
returnValue.Description__c:
Join me for a fun weekday trip being offered for the 1st time as an adventure hiking and biking experience in the Green Mountains of Vermont. We will have 3 days/4nights of hiking and biking while staying at the comfortable Montclair ski lodge at the base of Mad River Glen ski area near the town of Waitsfield. The lodge has multiple bedrooms with bunk beds, a large, cozy living room and a smaller lower level living room with a foosball table, a large stocked kitchen and dining room for group meals, shared bathrooms and a large outdoor deck overlooking the Mad River. Bring your own linens/towels, sleeping bag, camp chair, breakfast & lunch makings, snacks, and drinks including favorite alcoholic options for happy hours. Pillows are provided. A waiver for the use of the lodge will be required for each person. The link for the waiver will be sent to participants. Lodging is $140 pp for 4 nights. Send a check for the full amount made out to AMC DelVal chapter to Marty Keck. Address: 4140 Pine Hurst Drive, Northampton, PA. Deadline is 8/13/25. A waitlist will be kept.


Options for dinner include dinner cooked by the ski lodge chef for an extra fee one evening, potluck and/ or restaurant outings as desired. Waitsfield and the Sugarbush ski area have multiple shops and restaurants to enjoy. The Mad River ski area also has a pub that will be open for happy hours and dinner if desired.


Many hiking trails are in the area including trails right from our base lodge that connect to the Long Trail at the top. There are a variety of levels of hiking in the area for everyone to enjoy. Planning is underway. Burlington, Vermont and Stowe both offer biking opportunities so this can be organized easily depending on interest. Bring sturdy hiking shoes and poles, a bike in good working condition, spare tubes and helmet(required) if you wish to bike.


Please note: In order to comply with Pennsylvania Youth Protection laws, all children under the age of 18 must be accompanied by their parent or legal guardian. This policy applies for all events offered by the Delaware Valley Chapter as well as any other Chapter events within the state of Pennsylvania.

returnValue.Activity_Name__c: Fall Trip to the White Mountains, NH
returnValue.Description__c:
Please join us for an extended weekend of day hiking, camaraderie, beautiful views, and vigorous exercise in the White Mountains of NH. Our lodging near North Conway, NH will provide easy access to hikes of varying distance, elevation, and terrain. We'll choose from multiple hikes offered each day by our volunteer leaders. Some will ascend stunning peaks. Others will linger by mountain ponds. Wherever you go, expect long views and challenging experiences, some above tree-line. 

 

Dates: Arrive Wednesday, September 10 and leave Sunday, September 14th 2025

Location: North Conway, New Hampshire, White Mountains, NH Registration is required for this activity. Please contact registrar: michele_valerio@yahoo.com

 

Lodging will be four nights at the Fox Ridge Resort in North Conway New Hampshire. The exact address is 1979 White Mountain Highway, North Conway, NH 03860.The hotel room rate is $576 total for all 4 nights which includes tax. The room rate is for two people and can be split if you are sharing a room. The price includes breakfast. Rooms have a refrigerator. Wireless internet is available throughout the hotel. Indoor recreation facility includes indoor heated pool, Jacuzzi, and miniature golf. Website for Fox Ridge Resort https://www.foxridgeresort.com/

 

Rooms must be secured by credit card by one person in each room. We will do our best to fill any openings due to cancellations, but registrants are responsible for their share of room charges. We expect them to fill quickly, therefore please register early. Please register with the leader before calling hotel and specify if you will be rooming alone or with a roommate. When calling the hotel for reservations we are under AMC Fall Hiking week/Valerio. Hotel phone number is (603) 356-3151. Dinners can be at local restaurants or in your room. Numerous restaurants are in the immediate area, and some are within walking distance. Participants provide trail lunches, snacks, and Social Hour appetizers & beverages. A supermarket is nearby.

returnValue.Activity_Name__c: Exploring Cape Cod and Nantucket by Bike
returnValue.Description__c:
Join us for a 5-day adventure in Cape Cod. Our itinerary will include pedaling the Cape Cod Rail Trail and Shining Sea Bikeway while we explore the quaint towns, seacoast and lighthouses along the National Seashore. 

A full day trip via high-speed ferry with bike in tow to Nantucket [Approximately $60/pp plus $14 for bicycle] 

Daily mileage approximately 20-25 miles. We could not head home without enjoying the classic charm, vibrant arts and dining on Commercial Street, Provincetown. 

Lodging in shared cabins at Yarmouth Country Cabins in South Yarmouth with full kitchens, linens included [approx. $80/pp per night]; some private cabins available, pre-arranged pot-luck dinners. 

Appropriate gear is required - hybrid/mountain bike and tires in good condition, patch kit/extra tube; helmet is mandatory! 

Group size limited. A $80.00 non-refundable deposit is required to secure your spot [unless your spot can be filled]. $10 Activity Fee. Contact L to register and for additional information.

returnValue.Activity_Name__c: Wilderness First Aid, CPR AED at French Creek State Park
returnValue.Description__c:
People get sick and people get hurt. Learn how to assess and treat injuries and illnesses when outside help may be unavailable.. Certification offered through The Emergency Care and Safety Institute, underwritten by The American Academy of Osteopathic Physicians and the American College of Emergency Physicians. Join Larry and other instructors for a 16 hour class on Saturday and Sunday with optional CPR, AED certification class Friday evening at 7 PM. ( Part of the CPR class is covered in the WFA class and cannot be taken alone). $80.00 for WFA Cert and $30.00 for CPR AED. Tent site or rustic cabin bunks are included at no extra charge. Modern cabins or offsite accommodations are available . Classes are held inside the Mess hall. Wear suitable clothing as some incidents take place outdoors and on the ground.

Subjects covered include Trauma: lacerations, abrasions, sprains, strains, fractures, bleeds, and more, Illnesses: Cardiac, Stroke, Diabetes, Allergy, Anaphylaxis, and more.

returnValue.Activity_Name__c: DelVal Chapter Outdoor Leader Training!
returnValue.Description__c:
DelVal Chapter Outdoor Leader Training


Do you want to step up and lead activities for the AMC DelVal Chapter? If so, this workshop is for YOU! Mark your calendar for Saturday October 4! Please be sure to read the entire description if you are interested:


The Delaware Valley Chapter will hold an extra Leader Training this year! This one will be a joint DelVal-NYNoJ Chapter Leader Training, so it will be held in northern New Jersey (in Mahwah). The exact location will be provided to registrants. Due to the distance, the training will have reasonable start & end times so that you can comfortably drive up and back in one day. (If you’d like to make a weekend of it, there are hotels in the area for every budget, and beautiful hiking trails in the area). This posting is only for Delaware Valley Chapter members to register. There will be a separate NYNoJ Chapter posting for NYNoJ Chapter members to register.


NEW format! Our prior trainings have required two days of in-person training. This NEW format requires only ONE day in-person in addition to online go-at-your-own-pace AMC trainings you can do in the comfort of your own home! The online trainings should take about 6 hours total, but you don’t have to do them all in one sitting- do each segment when you have time. The online components must be completed prior to the in-person training.


This training has limited seats for DelVal, and these seats are for AMC-DelVal members who are willing and eager to lead activities for our Chapter! We look forward to welcoming you into our wonderful leader community!


The in-person training day utilizes an experiential model where you spend some of the time outdoors to participate in mock scenarios. Not only is this method a more effective approach to learning – it’s also fun!

 

During the training, you will have opportunities to network with several current leaders through camaraderie and informative programs. You will instantly feel part of our AMC family. Topics covered are the elements of outdoor leadership common to all AMC outdoor activities:


Activity planning

Leading safe and enjoyable activities

Risk Prevention

Liability issues

Accident scene management

Immersion in role play scenarios

AMC leadership requirements and guidelines

And more!


Instructors: Experienced AMC volunteers


What’s the cost? This one is FREE for AMC-DV members who want to lead for our DelVal Chapter!


HOW TO REGISTER:


DelVal Chapter members- Contact Mary Toomey, AMC-DV Leadership Chair for additional information at leadership@amcdv.org Registration will be completed after you communicate with Mary. She will ask a few basic questions such as what types of activities you would like to lead, areas where you would like to lead, etc. Please note: You will not be able to register here in Outdoors Connector until you have done that.

Note: Mary will also send you a link to the main portion of the online training. The online portion is to be done at home prior to the in-person training.

NY-NoJ Chapter members- Please respond to the NY-NoJ Chapter posting once it is posted in Outdoors Connector.

returnValue.Activity_Name__c: It's Not Too Late! Field Trip Participant Sign-Ups for 2025
returnValue.Description__c:

returnValue.Activity_Name__c: Winter Fun Ski & Snowshoe - Keene Valley, NY
returnValue.Description__c:
Join us for fun and camaraderie in the snow! Cross-country ski and/or snowshoe in the beautiful Keene Valley-Lake Placid area. We will take both lodges at Rock & River which is situated at the Jack Rabbit trailhead. Cross-country ski or snowshoe right from the door! Both lodges have a full kitchen. There are several options to ski and explore this beautiful winter wonderland: Mt. Van Hoevenberg Cross Country Ski, Cascades Ski Center, Scotts Cobble Nordic Center and Paul Smith's VIC. Ski rentals available. Take a break and spend some time in lovely Lake Placid. Après-ski gathering, followed by pre-arranged pot-luck dinners and of course, games and socializing to follow. Lodging for three nights approximately $225/pp; a non-refundable $50/deposit is required to hold your reservation. All linens and firewood provided. Bring breakfast/lunch fixings and appropriate gear. Contact leader for additional information. Rock & River https://rockandriver.com/ [GPS 44.26651, -73.85022]


Contact Leader to be added to the waitlist.


Please note: In order to comply with Pennsylvania Youth Protection Laws, all children under the age of 18 must be accompanied by their parent or legal guardian. This policy applies for all events offered by the Delaware Valley Chapter as well as any other Chapter events within the state of Pennsylvania.

returnValue.Activity_Name__c: Winter Fun Ski & Snowshoe - Lapland Lake
returnValue.Description__c: Join us for winter fun at Lapland Lake nestled in the Adirondacks, with a 'Finnish flare' - all the trails and cabins are in Finnish. Our cottages [tupas] have a full kitchen, include all linens, a stocked wood burning stove, plus more. Includes full access to cross country ski & 12km snowshoe trails, children's tubing hill & ice-skating. Evening use of illuminated ski trails, tubing hill & ice-skating; discounted group ski lesson per guest & use of the authentic Finnish wood burning sauna. [join our group's tubing competition - a must] Ski or snowshoe out the door; no driving needed! Pre-planned pot-luck dinners at our tupa; Approximately $250 for 3-day; 2-nights. $125 non-refundable deposit required; unless your spot can be filled. Group size very limited. Equipment rental available. Contact Leader for additional information - theresab1949@gmail.com
